faults.title: Leaks
faults.description: Steam escapes through cracks or holes in the engine, reducing its efficiency and power output.

faults.title: Overheating
faults.description: The engine reaches temperatures that are too high, causing damage to the metal components and reducing its lifespan.

faults.title: Lack of compression
faults.description: Insufficient compression of steam in the cylinders, resulting in reduced power output and efficiency.

faults.title: Excessive wear and tear
faults.description: Friction and wear on moving parts, such as piston rings and valves, can reduce the engine's efficiency and lifespan.

faults.title: Cylinder distortion
faults.description: The cylinders become misshapen or warped, causing uneven compression and reduction in power output.

faults.title: Incorrect fuel-to-water ratio
faults.description: Using too much or too little fuel can result in an imbalance of steam production, leading to reduced efficiency and power output.

faults.title: Worn or damaged valves
faults.description: Valves become worn or damaged, causing leaks or uneven distribution of steam, resulting in reduced power output and efficiency.

faults.title: Incorrect timing
faults.description: The timing of the valves and pistons is not correct, leading to uneven compression and reduction in power output.

faults.title: Excessive smoke
faults.description: Smoke or soot accumulates in the engine, indicating excessive wear and tear on the cylinders and piston rings.

faults.title: Low steam pressure
faults.description: The steam pressure is too low, resulting in reduced power output and efficiency.

faults.title: Misaligned connecting rods
faults.description: The connecting rods are not properly aligned, causing uneven compression and reduction in power output.

faults.title: Incorrect boiler pressure
faults.description: The boiler pressure is too high or too low, resulting in reduced efficiency and power output.
